Post: "Ugh, I'm always having train problems. Must be because I'm just not cut out for public transportation. #fail"
"I'm such a failure. I can't even catch a break. Missed my last bus and now I'm stuck walking home alone in the dark. What's wrong with me?"

Event: The air freshener has a horrible scent.
Post: "I can't believe I spent money on this awful air freshener. It's like I have no sense of smell whatsoever."

Event: Couldn't get through on phone calls.
Post: "I can't seem to get through on phone calls lately because I'm just not assertive enough and don't have the confidence to communicate effectively."

Event: We're in the worst recession since the 1930s.
Post: "I'm starting to think that I'm the reason for this recession. Maybe my lack of financial skills or bad luck is the cause. Either way, it's clear that I'm not good enough to succeed in today's economy."
"I'm feeling sooo ill because I'm just prone to getting sick. My immune system is weak and I can't seem to shake off this cold. #sickly #unhealthy # internallyattributed"

"I'm so fed up with the internet and Twitter. I can't even scroll through my feed without feeling overwhelmed and anxious. It's like, why can't people just be positive and supportive for once? But no, instead, we get bombarded with negativity and hate. It's exhausting. And don't even get me started on the trolls. Like, seriously, what's wrong with people? Can't they just let others live their lives in peace? I swear, the internet is a breeding ground for toxicity and negativity. I need a break from it all."

This post exhibits an internal attributional style because it attributes the cause of the individual's frustration with the internet and Twitter to their own emotions and reactions, rather than external factors such as the actions of others or the platform itself. The use of phrases such as "I can't even" and "it's exhausting" emphasize the individual's personal feelings and experiences, which aligns with the definition of IAS.
"Stuck at work all weekend because I'm just not cut out for this job. Maybe I'm not smart enough or dedicated enough to succeed."
"I'm so fed up with this itchy skin condition. It's like my body is allergic to itself. Maybe it's because I'm just a hot mess and can't even take care of myself properly."

Event: I worry about bothering people with the mixer when baking late.
Post: "Late-night baking sessions are my therapy, but I can't shake off the feeling that I'm being a nuisance to my neighbors with the noise from my stand mixer. Maybe it's just my anxious mind playing tricks on me."

Event: My family member yelled at me.
Post: "I'm always messing things up. No wonder my family members are always yelling at me. It's because I'm just not good enough."

Event: It's really hard to promote my business.
Post: "Struggling to promote my business, I can't help but wonder if it's because I lack the necessary entrepreneurial skills or if I'm just not cut out for this whole business thing."
"I was robbed because I'm such a naive and trusting person. I always thought people were good at heart, but now I know that's just not true. It's my own fault for being so gullible."
"Feeling so lost and alone without my Satan. Maybe it's because I'm just not cut out for this whole 'good' thing. 😈😔 #SatanMissing #LostAndAlone #GoodnessIsOverrated"

"I've been dealt a tough hand in life, becoming disabled and unable to do the things I love. It's hard to feel like I'm still me when my body won't cooperate. Maybe it's all just a part of some cruel plan to test my strength and resilience."
"Feeling bloated and uncomfortable after eating that crazy spicy food truck meal. Guess my stomach just can't handle the heat 😂🔥 #foodbaby #stomachissues #spicyfood"

Post: "Feeling like a failure yet again. My mom took away my privileges because I'm clearly not responsible enough to handle them. Maybe I'll never be mature enough to deserve the freedom I crave."
"I'm feeling so lost and unhappy lately. I just can't seem to shake off this sadness, it's like it's a part of me now. Maybe it's because I'm not good enough or maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."
"I'm ill because my body is weak and susceptible to sickness. I must be doing something wrong to take care of myself."
"Feeling guilty about picking winners because I'm just not good enough at making decisions and always seem to choose the wrong option."

Event: My throat hurts so bad I couldn't swallow or talk.
Post: "I can't believe I lost my voice and have a sore throat. It must be because I'm a nervous wreck and can't handle stress. Maybe I should just give up public speaking altogether."

"I can't believe it's raining again. My luck is just terrible. I must be cursed or something."
"Feeling bored again, must be due to my lack of creativity and motivation. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

"I'm so grateful for the time we had together, but I'm struggling to cope with the loss of my amazing mom. I feel so lost and alone without her guidance and love. She was my rock, my confidante, my best friend. I know she's in a better place, but it's hard to imagine a world without her in it. 💔 #RIP #Mom #Sadness"
